item.title: Algorithm Complexity Analysis
item.description: Abstract § Analysis Space & Time, related with the input size and observing the trend when input size gets bigger The analysis isn’t limited to particular machine.

item.title: Java Sorting
item.description: Abstract § // Sort an array which has elements that are array of size 2 // Sort from the highest first element of sub-array, if same then sort from the lowest second element of sub-array Arrays.

item.title: Algorithms
item.description: Abstract § Set of Instruction Terminologies § Analysis § Make Algorithms more Memory-efficient & Space-efficient There is Algorithm Complexity Analysis .

item.title: Dynamic Programming
item.description: Abstract § 3 key components - Overlapping Subproblems (重复子问题), Optimal Substructure ( 最优子结构) & Statelessness (无后效性) Leetcode Tips § Debugging § Print out DP Table to check any errors Questions § Basics § Leetcode 509.

item.title: Double Pointers
item.description: Abstract § Mainly used to solve Array, String & Linked List related problems. Reduce time complexity by one dimension, O(n^2) to O(n) 3 Types § Fast, Slow § Reduce 2 nested for loops into 1 single for loop Can be used to remove elements from array in-place Can be used to determine if Linked List is a Circular Linked List Practice Questions 27.

item.title: Predicate
item.description: Abstract § Also known as Propositional Functions & Open Sentences Example: let P stand for is a student at NUS, then P(x) = x is a student at NUS, where x is the Variable, P is the Symbol Truth value depends on Variable Becomes a Mathematical Statement when specific values are substituted for Variable Returns either true or false, thus cant be used as a Variable that is substituted into Symbol like P() Made of Symbol & finite number of Variable Terminologies § Variable § Holds value that determines if Predicate is true or false It doesn't hold the value of true or false! Only Mathematical Statement can be true or false Symbol § Represents a property or relation Quantifiers § Instead of manually assign a specific value to Variable to obtain a Mathematical Statement Quantifiers is another way, specific how many of a particular type of values that make the predicate true ∀ ∃ Order of Quantifiers § Unless the Quantifiers are of the same type.

item.title: Mathematical Statement
item.description: Abstract § Also known as Proposition 3 important types are Universal, Conditional & Existential We can form statements that are Universal & Conditional, or more to form complex statements Either True or False Warning Doesn’t depend on any Variable, unless it is Logical Equivalence equation Not in a question form Different Types of Statements § Universal § Made of Symbol, Variable & Quantifiers ∀x∈D,Q(x) true iff Q(x) is true for every x in D false iff Q(x) is false for at least one x in D For simple ones, usually universal comes with Conditional Statement Existential § Made of Symbol, Variable & Quantifiers ∃x∈D,Q(x) true iff Q(x) is true for at least one x in D false iff Q(x) is false for all x in D For simple ones, usually existential comes with Conjunction Negation of Universal § Logical Equivalence to Existential There is AT LEAST ONE that IS NOT ¬(∀x∈D,Q(x))≡∃x∈D,¬Q(x) Negation of Existential § Logical Equivalence to Universal ALL ARE NOT ¬(∃x∈D,Q(x))≡∀x∈D,¬Q(x) Negation of Universal Conditional § Make use of Negation of Universal & Implication Law Universal Conditional § Made of Symbol, Variable & Quantifiers & Conditional Statement ∀x(ifP(x)→Q(x)) Can be simplified to Universal ∀x∈P,Q(x) Conditional § Conditional Statement If…, then… Terminologies § Statement § A sentence that is True or False, but not both Can be presented with variables like p, q, r & s etc Logical Connectives § Negation: NOT performed first Disjunction: OR ,Conjunction: AND coequal, make sure proper parentheses is used to avoid Ambiguous If-then/implies: performed last, coequal with iff Statement/Propositional Form § Make up with Statement variables & Logical Connectives Compound Statement § Make up with Statement variables & Logical Connectives When the statement has Conditional Statement, convert it using Implication Law to make it much less confusing Tautology t § Statement/Propositional Form that is always true Contradiction c § Statement/Propositional Form that is always false Implicitly Quantified § The Quantifiers are assumed without specified explicitly Vacuous Truth of Universal § Given the statement: All balls in the bowl are blue, however no balls in the bowl.

item.title: Second Brain for CS
item.description: Navigation § Homepage is still under development. You can navigate around the notes using the explorer on the left side or visit the list of tags that categories the notes.

item.title: MIPS R-Type Instruction
item.description: Abstract § Opcode is always 000000 Operation is decided by the Function Code 6 parts - Opcode, Source Register, Target Register, Destination Register, Shift Amount & Function Code Terminologies § Function Code § 6 bits Give MIPS (2^6-1) + 2^6 = 127 instead of 2^6=64 Instruction Dedicated for MIPS R-Type Instruction (if my understanding isn’t wrong) Shift Amount § 5bits Labeled as shamt .

item.title: MIPS Instruction
item.description: Abstract § The Instruction may specify 3 Registers - Destination Register, Source Register & Target Register Terminologies § Destination Register § 5bits Labeled rd, mapped to WR Registers that gets the result of Operation in MIPS R-Type Instruction Instruction Source Register § 5bits Labeled rs, mapped to RR1 Register with value stored that we want to use to carry out Operation Target Register § 5 bits Labeled rt, mapped to RR2 Register with value stored we want to use in MIPS R-Type Instruction Register that gets the result of Operation in MIPS I-Type Instruction .
